alert.note: Alert for Southern Nassau; Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued January 01 at 4:08AM EST until January 02 at 9:00AM EST by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM EST THIS MORNING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 AM EST SUNDAY... * WHAT...For both Coastal Flood Advisories, up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Queens and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, until 8 AM EST this morning. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 6 AM to 9 AM EST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor flooding is also possible during high tide Sunday morning. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. ROCKAWAY INLET NY NEAR FLOYD BENNETT FIELD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - MINOR 7.3 FT, MODERATE 8.3 FT, MAJOR 9.3 FT MHHW CATEGORIES - MINOR 1.7 FT, MODERATE 2.7 FT, MAJOR 3.7 FT TOTAL TOTAL DEPARTURE DAY/TIME TIDE TIDE FROM NORM WAVES FLOOD FT MLLW FT MHHW FT FT IMPACT -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 01/06 AM 7.1/ 7.6 1.5/ 2.0 0.9/ 1.4 1 MINOR 01/07 PM 6.2/ 6.7 0.6/ 1.1 1.3/ 1.8 1 NONE 02/07 AM 7.5/ 8.0 1.9/ 2.3 1.1/ 1.6 1 MINOR 02/07 PM 6.2/ 6.7 0.6/ 1.1 1.2/ 1.7 2 NONE 03/08 AM 6.9/ 7.4 1.3/ 1.8 0.5/ 1.0 2 NONE 03/08 PM 5.7/ 6.2 0.1/ 0.6 0.6/ 1.1 1 NONE JAMAICA BAY AT INWOOD NY MLLW CATEGORIES - info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
